item.title: Finding Distressed Stocks
item.description: Finding Stocks at Risk of Financial Distress The goal of this analysis is to isolate stocks that are particularly risky to the long-only investor. A probability of distress will be computed based on observable financial data. The model was derived in academia and later utilized in a book titled “Quantitative Value” (2013). The Formula Logit Probability of Financial Distress (LPFD) A logistic regression model is used to estimate whether a firm is in financial distress or not.

item.title: Risk Parity Portfolio with R
item.description: Let’s try # Load packages library(riskParityPortfolio) library(fPortfolio) library(tidyverse) library(RMySQL) library(lubridate) library(timetk) library(tidyquant) # Load data # Establish a local MySQL connection con <- dbConnect(MySQL(), dbname = "stock_prices", user = 'root' , password='paperback12') prices <- tbl(con, "etfs") %>% as_tibble() prices %>% pull(symbol) %>% unique() #> [1] "VOO" "SCHB" "SPY" "VBR" "IWN" "IJS" "SCHF" "VNQ" # Get monthly returns etf_returns <- as_tibble(prices) %>% select(date, symbol, adjusted) %>% mutate(date = ymd(date)) %>% group_by(symbol) %>% tq_transmute(select = adjusted, periodReturn, period="monthly", type="log", col_rename = "monthly.
